data.title: Today's latest from Al Jazeera
data.meta_description: Stay on top of Yemen latest developments on the ground with Al Jazeera’s fact-based news, exclusive video footage, photos and updated maps.
data.text:
The number of acutely malnourished children has increased by 34% compared with last year, a United Nations report says.

Al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula claims responsibility for the attack that targeted STC fighters in Abyan.

The Yemeni group seizes UN Human Rights Office in the capital Sanaa as it extends a crackdown on foreign organisations.

Houthis say ship in Gulf of Aden struck by ballistic missiles in first attack since Israeli strike on Hodeidah port.

Since October 7, Israel has been responsible for more than 17,000 attacks in the Middle East.

Strikes on Houthi-controlled port city had been stopped out of fear of humanitarian fallout before Israel attacked.

Four survivors found after boat capsized off coast of Taiz governorate due to strong winds and overcrowding, UNHCR says.

A day after a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israeli air raids on a key Yemeni port city leave heavy flames and black smoke

Hans Grundberg says recent developments suggest ‘threat against international shipping is increasing in scope’.

The Houthis have endured a half-year of American strikes, delivering US President Biden a major foreign policy defeat.

The Yemeni group remains undeterred in its support for Palestine despite the massive Israeli attack on a key port.

Israel says the unprecedented Houthi attack on Tel Aviv was a result of a reengineered drone.
